Cuerpo: The entire course is covered by the lecture notes, which are accessible online from the course home page. The notes are also available in hardcopy for $7 from Linda Mardel, 5147 Upson. J. E. Hopcroft and J. D. Ullman. Addison-Wesley, 1979. H. Lewis and C. Papadimitriou. Elements of the Theory of Computation . Prentice-Hall, 1981. M. A. Harrison. Addison-Wesley, 1978. will be available online. They are accessible from the course home page. Homework sets and handouts will be posted periodically. It is your responsibility to check for new postings. Free-ranging technical discussions are especially encouraged. Homework and Exams There will be weekly homework assignments consisting of 4-6 problems, due Wednesday at 4pm. You must pass it in to the TA, not to the instructor, secretary, or undergrad office. Please clear it with the TA in advance if possible. Homework assignments and solutions will be available online and accessible from the course home page. The prelims, final and homework will each be worth approximately a third of your grade. If you are not sure which course is right for you, please come talk to us.
